org.openremote.console.controller.connector

Class AndroidHttpConnector

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.openremote.console.controller.connector.AndroidHttpConnector
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ControllerConnector, CommandSender, ResourceLocator

    public class AndroidHttpConnector
extends java.lang.Object
    Android specific connector capable of calling callback on the UI thread via the Android Looper Handler
    Author:
    Richard Turner

    • Field Summary

      • Fields inherited from interface org.openremote.console.controller.connector.ControllerConnector

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void connect(AsyncControllerCallback<ControllerConnectionStatus> callback)
      Connects to the controller and maintains the connection; it is the connectors responsibility to notify the caller via the callback onFailure method when the connection closes for some reason
      void disconnect()
      Disconnects from the controller asynchronously; does nothing if not already connected.
      java.lang.String getControllerIdentity()
      Gets the unique controller identity
      java.net.URL getControllerUrl()
      Gets the controller URL
      Credentials getCredentials()
      Returns the currently active credentials
      void getDevice(java.lang.String deviceName, AsyncControllerCallback<Device> callback)
      Returns Device that matches the supplied device name.
      void getDeviceList(AsyncControllerCallback<java.util.List<DeviceInfo>> callback)
      Returns List of DeviceInfo of devices that are recognised by this controller.
      void getPanel(java.lang.String panelName, AsyncControllerCallback<Panel> callback)
      Returns Panel definition of the specified panel.
      void getPanelList(AsyncControllerCallback<java.util.List<PanelInfo>> callback)
      Returns List of PanelInfo of panels that are recognised by this controller.
      void getResourceData(java.lang.String resourceName, AsyncControllerCallback<ResourceDataResponse> callback)
      Get the data of the named resource asynchronously (e.g.
      void getResourceInfoDetails(java.lang.String resourceName, AsyncControllerCallback<ResourceInfoDetails> callback)
      Get the details of the named resource asynchronously
      void getSensorValues(java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> sensorIds, AsyncControllerCallback<java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>> callback)
      Returns Map of sensor IDs and values.
      int getTimeout()
      Get the timeout in milliseconds for this connector
      boolean isConnected()
      Indicates if the connector is currently connected to the controller
      boolean isDiscoveryRunning()
      Determines if controller discovery is currently running
      void logout(AsyncControllerCallback<java.lang.Boolean> callback)
      Logs out of the controller.
      void monitorSensors(java.lang.String uuid, java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> sensorIds, AsyncControllerCallback<java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>> callback)
      Returns Map of sensor IDs and values only for sensors whose values have changed since the last request.
      void sendCommand(Command command, java.lang.String parameter, AsyncControllerCallback<CommandResponse> callback)
      Returns Boolean indicating whether command send request was successful.
      void sendControlCommand(ControlCommand command, AsyncControllerCallback<ControlCommandResponse> callback)
      Returns Boolean indicating whether control command send request was successful.
      void setControllerUrl(java.net.URL controllerUrl)
      Sets the controller URL
      void setCredentials(Credentials credentials)
      Sets the Credentials to be used by this connector
      void setTimeout(int timeout)
      Set the timeout in milliseconds for this connector
      void startDiscovery(AsyncControllerDiscoveryCallback callback, int tcpPort, java.lang.Integer searchDuration)
      Perform controller discovery for the specified period of time using the specified TCP port and call onDiscoveryStarted, if discovery cannot be started then call onStartDiscoveryFailed.
      void stopDiscovery()
      Stop current controller discovery and call onDiscoveryStopped of callback provided at startDiscovery

      • connect

        public void connect(AsyncControllerCallback<ControllerConnectionStatus> callback)
        Description copied from interface: ControllerConnector

      • disconnect

        public void disconnect()
        Description copied from interface: ControllerConnector
        Disconnects from the controller asynchronously; does nothing if not already connected. When disconnect is completed the onFailure method of the connect callback will be called with a ControllerResponseCode of ControllerResponseCode.DISCONNECTED.
        Specified by:
        disconnect in interface ControllerConnector

      • monitorSensors

        public void monitorSensors(java.lang.String uuid,
                  java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> sensorIds,
                  AsyncControllerCallback<java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.lang.String>> callback)
        Description copied from interface: ControllerConnector
        Returns Map of sensor IDs and values only for sensors whose values have changed since the last request.
        Specified by:
        monitorSensors in interface ControllerConnector
        Parameters:
        uuid - Unique identifier for this monitor request to allow tracking between sensor polls
        sensorIds - List of sensor IDs to monitor
        callback - AsyncControllerCallback callback for handling the response asynchronously

      • startDiscovery

        public void startDiscovery(AsyncControllerDiscoveryCallback callback,
                  int tcpPort,
                  java.lang.Integer searchDuration)
        Description copied from interface: ControllerConnector
        Perform controller discovery for the specified period of time using the specified TCP port and call onDiscoveryStarted, if discovery cannot be started then call onStartDiscoveryFailed. When a new controller is discovered call onControllerFound.
        Specified by:
        startDiscovery in interface ControllerConnector

        public void stopDiscovery()
        Description copied from interface: ControllerConnector
        Stop current controller discovery and call onDiscoveryStopped of callback provided at startDiscovery
